title: Consumer Price Index of all urban consumers , by region 2019
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
The highest Country West has 32.57 more Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) than the lowest Country Midwest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) for 5 number of Countrys.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
The highest value at Country West is 1.14x times more than the lowest value at Midwest.
The Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984), followed by Northeast, and U.S. city average. Down to the Country Midwest which is the lowest.
The Country Midwest tends to be 1.06 percent lower than average.
